mdRecord.dcterms:title: San Juan Capistrano Library, exterior
Orange County Public Library
San Juan Capistrano Regional Library
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Graves, Michael (American architect, born 1934) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Designed by Michael Graves, the library has received a prestigious honor award from the American Institute of Architects, and has been called "the first authentic postmodern masterpiece" by Newsweek magazine. -- http://www.sanjuancapistrano.org/index.aspx?page=454 In this small one-story building (about 12,000 square feet) Graves borrows from the local Spanish idiom, using stucco walls, mission clay roof tiles, wooden beams, mini-towers, small punched windows, light monitors, stencil ornament, and loggias around a central courtyard. -- http://www.bluffton.edu/~sullivanm/gravessjc/gravessjc.html [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
public buildings
lattices
towers (building divisions)
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 31495 El Camino Real, San Juan Capistrano, Orange, California, United States
